channel.title: Emr on Cerebral Mastication
channel.description: Recent content in Emr on Cerebral Mastication

item.title: Bootstrapping the latest R into Amazon Elastic Map Reduce
item.description: I’ve been continuing to muck around with using R inside of Amazon Elastic Map reduce jobs. I’ve been working on abstracting the lapply() logic so that R will farm the pieces out to Amazon EMR. This is coming along really well, thanks in no small part to the Stack Overflow [r] community. I have no idea how crappy coders like me got anything at all done before the Interwebs. One of the immediate hurdles faced when trying to use AMZN EMR in anger is that the default version of R on EMR is 2.
